poem:
Title: In The Shadow of Brexit 

A grizzled weft of sovereignty,  
Entangled in the cost of border sentinels.  
The National Audit, like a grey gull, cries  
Over shortages, and the sea's reap of delays.  
This island, bound in trade's rough hands,  
Boasts its Brexit harvest, a meagre wreath  
Paid in £4.7bn of stubborn poundage.  
Oh, Albion, are these your chosen pains?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Post-Brexit border checks forecast to cost UK £4.7bn, says NAO The government expects to have spent at least £4.7bn on introducing post-Brexit border controls, which have been repeatedly hit by delays, the public spending watchdog has warned. Plans to bring in border checks on goods coming from the EU faced “significant issues” including critical shortages of inspectors before their introduction last month, the National Audit Office said in a report. The UK has said it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
